overview: Gabriele Gresta is considered worldwide as one of the biggest expert in digital medias and technologies, specialising in viral projects, participative television and new TV formats designed for various digital platforms. Gabriele Gresta started at a very young age in the software field. By age 15, he was Software Development Director in a multinational company (Alpha Center Int.). At 16 Gresta created the first super-learning system with various technical internships in the UK,US and Australia. He unleashed his musical creativity with the Mato Grosso digital dance music project bringing him on an international tour for 11 months. In five years Mato Grosso hit Top Ten several times. In Tv Gresta was host, author and producer of hit programs on MTV. On Tmc2 he hosted Altromondo, the first daily Italian Tv show dedicated to Video Games. He was also an actor with a mainstream role in two films: “Il Segreto Del Giaguaro” and “Tobia Al CaffÃ¨”. In 1995 Gabriele Gresta founded Bibop Research Int, a cross-media agency that creates interactive projects such as the Mediaset portal, hosted Futurshow, Tim Tour, and the I-Tv Alice Live for Telecom Italia. In 1999 Gabriele Gresta sold 40% of Bibop to Telecom Italia for 11 Billion (Italian Lira) hitting the Italian media with the creation of one of the first successful case history in the Italian New economy. In 2000 he created and produced the first ever Tv Format that used the â€œSMSâ€ as a form of interaction: “2008” for the national Tv Italia1. In 2003, Gabriele Gresta founded DigitalMagics Group, a digital media company incubator. Between 2009 and 2010 Gresta is in charge of M&A and International Business Development of the Digital Magics company. DM collected around 15 mln euros from the partners and from private investors. The money has been invested in the 31 companies of the group to sustain the growth. In 2011 he joined Braispark L.t.d. a stock listed U.K. company specialized in investments.
